summary.para: Lists chart segment grouping options.
Do not group chart segments.
Group all segments with the value less than the value of the property.
Group all segments that have an index that is equal to or greater than the value of the property.
Lists options of arranging scale labels when there is not enough space to keep all of them.
The certain scale labels are hidden, leaving more space for the others.
The scale labels are overlapped.
Lists values determining the type of the scale.
The scale type defined automatically based on the applied value.
Default. The scale displays numeric or date-time values.
The scale displays string values.
The scale displays numeric values.
The scale displays numeric values.
For internal use only.
For internal use only
For internal use only
For internal use only
For internal use only
Lists the values that define the type of the chart axis scale.
A scale type is determined automatically according to scale values.
Default for numeric and date-time values. The scale is divided into equal intervals automatically or you can specify custom intervals using the and properties.

A logarithmic scale is useful when you visualize a dataset of rapidly-growing values. Each scale tick represents a particular value () that is raised to the next power in turn. For example, if you set LogarithmBase to 5, the following ticks will be generated: 5^0, 5^1, 5^2, 5^3, etc.
Lists values defining when to call the event's handler.
The function is called upon every move of the sliders regardless of its completion.
The function is called once the slider move is completed.
Lists values that define how to arrange axis labels when there is insufficient space to keep all of them.
Tick intervals are enlarged to such an extent that there is no overlapped elements.
The overlapping is ignored.
Lists values of chart behavior when labels overlap. Allows you to hide certain labels, or slightly shift them, or keep them as they are (i.e., overlapping).
The PieChart automatically determines and hides overlapping labels in the order of their addition to the data source.
Default. The label location is specified by default.

para.para: The PieChart control tries to shift chart labels to show them without overlapping. If there is not enough space for all labels, the control hides labels with the smallest value.

summary.para: Lists values for ticks and grid lines positioning on a discrete axis in case the discrete axis is divided.
Default. The ticks/grid lines are located between labels.
The ticks/grid lines are located in front of labels.
Lists the values that define how error bar values must be calculated.
The error bars type is undefined.
Defines the confidential interval in constant values.
Defines the confidential interval in percentages.
Defines the standard deviation.
Defines the standard deviation of its sampling distribution.
Defines the variance.
Lists values that define how value error bars are displayed.
Required value error bars (low and/or high) are determined automatically.
Only high value error bars are displayed.
Only low value error bars are displayed.
Value error bars are not displayed.
Lists values defining the type of chart points.
Circular chart points.
Cross chart points.
Polygonal chart points.
Square chart points.
Triangle-down chart points.
Triangle-up chart points.
Lists the values that define what series elements to highlight when a corresponding item in the legend is hovered over.
When a legend item is hovered over, the corresponding series is highlighted, but its points are excluded.
When a legend item is hovered over, the corresponding series is highlighted along with its points.
A legend hover does not affect a chart appearance.
Lists values that specify the used Bootstrap framework version.
Bootstrap v3 is used.
Bootstrap v4 is used.
Lists values specifying a bootstrap class used to style an image.
Defines a circular image.
Defines a responsive image.
Defines a rounded image.
Defines a thumbnail-shaped image.
Lists the values that define external icon libraries supported by DevExpress Bootstrap controls.
Applies the embedded icon set to a control.
Applies the Font Awesome icon set to a control.
Applies the GLYPHICONS icon set to a control.
A method that will handle the event.

Lists the values that specify a predefined type of text formatting.
A value is divided by one billion, the letter 'B' is added.
Displays a value as currency.
Displays a value as a day.
Displays a value as a day of the week.
Displays a value in the decimal format with an optional negative sign.
Displays a value in the exponential notation.
Displays a value as a real numeric value with a specified number of digits for the fractional part and an optional negative sign
Displays the value as an hour.
A value is divided by a number (one thousand, one million, one billion or one trillion) so that the value is less than a thousand; then a corresponding letter ('K', 'M', 'B' or 'T') is added.
Displays a value using the long date format. Thursday, January 01, 1970
Displays a value using the long date and long time format. Thursday, January 01, 1970, 12:00:00 AM
Displays a value using the long time format. 12:00:00 AM
A value is divided by one billion, the letter 'M' is added.
Displays a value as milliseconds.
Displays a value as minutes.
Displays a value as a month.
Displays a value using the month and day format. January 01
Displays a value using the month and year format. 1970 January
Display a value without formatting.
A value is multiplied by 100 and displayed with a percent symbol.
Displays a value using the quarter format. QI
Displays a value using the quarter and year format. QI 1970
Displays a value as seconds.
Displays a value using the short date format. 1/25/1970
Displays a value using the short date and short time format. 1/25/1970, 12:00 AM
Displays a value using the short time format. 12:00 AM
A value is divided by one billion, the letter 'K' is added.
A value is divided by one billion, the letter 'T' is added.
The value is displayed as a year.
Lists values that define which point prices (high, low, open or close) should be compared.
Close prices should be compared.
High prices should be compared.
Low prices should be compared.
Open prices should be compared.
